node.title: What is stopping Max Verstappen from crashing into Lewis Hamilton to win the Formula 1 championship?
node.alt: Man weating a blue cap frowns.
node.description: Formula 1 has the season finale every fan wanted to see. But aggressive driving and desire for success could lead to a dramatic and controversial conclusion, writes Michael Doyle.
node.content:
["\"To finish first, first you must finish.\"", "It is a popular phrase in the world of motorsport, and variations of the saying have been used by some of Formula 1's greats.\u00a0", "It is also very applicable to this weekend's F1 title decider in Abu Dhabi.", "Max Verstappen and Lewis Hamilton are level on 369.5 world championship points going into the final grand prix of the season.", "It means whoever finishes ahead of the other around the Yas Marina circuit will be champion.", "", "
Hamilton and Verstappen have had multiple battles on track in 2021.(Getty Images: Bryn Lennon)
", "But there is a possibility they end the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix level on points.", "If this happens, Red Bull's Verstappen will be crowned champion because he will have more race wins than Hamilton.", "And there are two scenarios where this could happen.", "One driver can finish ninth, while the other finishes 10th and claims the fastest lap, meaning they both earn two championship points.", "However, the more likely scenario would be both drivers not scoring any points.", "This is where the popular saying about needing to finish is applicable.", "Many championships through the years have come down to the final race and sometimes one driver has taken the most drastic measure into his own hands.", "In both the 1989 and 1990 seasons, Ayrton Senna and Alain Prost collided with each other in the final race, with the championship up for grabs.", "Michael Schumacher deliberately drove into Damon Hill in 1994 to keep his championship lead in the title decider.", "In each case, the driver leading the championship going into those races was able to win the title.", "So what is stopping Max Verstappen, who has shown a desire to drive aggressively all season, from running Hamilton off the road and winning his first world championship?", "
Schumacher's dodgy tactics disqualified him from 1997 championship
", "After Michael Schumacher crashed\u00a0into Damon Hill to secure the world championship in 1994, the\u00a0German superstar found himself in the same position three years later.", "Schumacher, trying to deliver Ferrari their first drivers' championship in 18 years, held a narrow lead over Williams driver Jacques Villeneuve.", "Heading into the title decider in the Spanish city of Jerez, Villeneuve and his Williams team told every man and their dog that Schumacher would try to take him out and secure the championship.", "", "
Jacques Villeneuve (right) repeatedly mentioned Michael Schumacher (left) could crash into him ahead of the 1997 title decider.(Reuters: File)
", "Not a press conference went by when Villeneuve didn't remind the world of what Schumacher had done three years earlier.", "It was a prophecy that came true when Villeneuve went for a drive up the inside of Schumacher for the lead, and the German crashed into him.", "However, the contact caused terminal damage to Schumacher\"s car, while Villeneuve was able to limp home for third and win his only championship.", "", "
Schumacher was leading Villeneuve before the Williams driver caught him in Jerez.(Reuters: File)
", "But that was not the end of the matter, with the FIA drawing a line in the sand on drivers deliberately taking out opponents to win championships.", "The FIA disqualified Schumacher from the drivers' championship. However, his race wins still counted.", "Despite having the second-most points, Schumacher, as far as the record books are concerned, effectively finished last and the FIA set a precedent to follow.", "
What if Verstappen tempts fate in Abu Dhabi?
", "Verstappen and Hamilton have been fighting wheel to wheel all year.", "Neither has wanted to give an inch, but Verstappen has shown himself to be the more aggressive driver.", "Then there was the incident at\u00a0Silverstone, where\u00a0Hamilton was penalised for knocking Verstappen out of the race. It\u00a0didn't matter, because the Briton still won.", "But Verstappen has forced Hamilton into compromising positions at Imola, in Saudi Arabia and most infamously at Monza, when his car ended on top of Hamilton's head.", "", "
Max Verstappen crashed into Lewis Hamilton at Monza, taking them both out of the race.(Getty: Peter Van Egmond)
", "The Dutchman's desire to seemingly win at all costs raises the question. If he has a chance, will he try to force Hamilton off the track and out of the race?", "If he does it will be a very bad look for the sport if the FIA do nothing about it.", "In title deciders since 1997, there has not been a deliberate act of one championship contender taking out a rival.", "Should Verstappen try it and be successful, he could well have the championship taken off him in a boardroom rather than the track.", "It is a scenario no-one wants to see, but many speculate is a real possibility."]
